plugin.name: b0RemoteApi
plugin.author: marc@coppeliarobotics.com
plugin.description: API functions for the BlueZero-based remote API.

command.name: simxServiceCall
command.description: Returns the topic for service calls

param.name: topic
param.description: The service call topic

command.name: simxDefaultPublisher
command.description: Returns the topic for the default publisher

param.name: topic
param.description: The default publisher topic

command.name: simxDefaultSubscriber
command.description: Returns the topic for the default subscriber

param.name: callBackFunc
param.description: The callback function for the subscriber

param.name: publishInterval
param.description: The rate (in terms of simulation loops) at which the server (i.e. V-REP) should publish the message

param.name: topic
param.description: The default subscriber topic

command.name: simxCreatePublisher
command.description: Creates a custom publisher topic, and returns it

param.name: dropMessages
param.description: Whether some messages will be dropped if a queue is forming. In that case, the freshest messages will be retained

param.name: topic
param.description: The topic of the created publisher

command.name: simxCreateSubscriber
command.description: Creates a custom subscriber topic, and returns it

param.name: callBackFunc
param.description: The callback function for the subscriber

param.name: publishInterval
param.description: The rate (in terms of simulation loops) at which the server (i.e. V-REP) should publish the message

param.name: dropMessages
param.description: Whether some messages will be dropped if a queue is forming. In that case, the freshest message will be retained

param.name: topic
param.description: The default subscriber topic

command.name: simxGetTimeInMs
command.description: Returns the system time in milliseconds

param.name: time
param.description: The time in milliseconds

command.name: simxSleep
command.description: Waits for a certain duration

param.name: durationInMs
param.description: The sleep time in milliseconds

command.name: simxSpin
command.description: Handles all callbacks for subscribers that have messages waiting, in a loop (i.e. does not return)

command.name: simxSpinOnce
command.description: Calls all callbacks for subscribers that have messages waiting, then returns

command.name: simxSynchronous
command.description: Enables/disables the V-REP synchronous mode during simulation. In synchonous mode, each simulation step will require an external trigger signal in order to be run

param.name: enable
param.description: The enable state of the synchonous mode

command.name: simxSynchronousTrigger
command.description: Triggers next simulation step, if the V-REP synchronous mode was previously enabled

command.name: simxGetSimulationStepDone
command.description: Checks whether the current simulation step finished executing

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call. Recommended is [L[#simxDefaultSubscriber]]

command.name: simxGetSimulationStepStarted
command.description: Checks whether the current simulation step finished executing

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call. Recommended is [L[#simxDefaultSubscriber]]

command.name: simxCallScriptFunction
command.description: Calls a script function inside of V-REP (i.e. server side)

param.name: funcAtObjName
param.description: A string representing the function name and script name, e.g. myFunctionName@theScriptName. When the script is not associated with an object, then just specify the function name

param.name: scriptType
param.description: The [L[apiConstants.htm#scriptTypes,type of the script]] (specified as number or string). E.g. 'sim.scripttype_mainscript' is a valid string argument that will be evaluated on the server side

param.name: funcArgs
param.description: [cpp[The function arguments, packed in a messagePack message]][java[The function arguments, packed in a messagePack message]][lua[The function argument(s). Group several arguments inside of a table]][matlab[The function argument(s). Group several arguments inside of an array]][python[The function argument(s). Group several arguments inside of a list]]

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The first return value of the called function

param.name: item3
param.description: The second return value of the called function

param.name: item4
param.description: etc.

command.name: simxGetObjectHandle
command.description: Retrieves the handle of an object

param.name: objectName
param.description: Name of object. If the name is appended by a "@alt" suffix, then the object handle based on the object's alternative name will be retrieved. If the name is appended by a "@silentError" suffix, then no error will be output if the object does not exist

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the object

command.name: simxAddStatusbarMessage
command.description: Adds a message to the status bar

param.name: msg
param.description: The message to display

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetObjectPosition
command.description: Retrieves the position of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame we want the position. Specify -1 to retrieve the absolute position, 'sim.handle_parent' to retrieve the position relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame you want the position

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The (X,Y,Z) position of the object

command.name: simxGetObjectOrientation
command.description: Retrieves the Euler angles orientation of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame we want the orientation. Specify -1 to retrieve the absolute orientation, 'sim.handle_parent' to retrieve the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame you want the orientation

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The (alpha,beta,gamma) Euler angles of the object

command.name: simxGetObjectQuaternion
command.description: Retrieves the quaternion orientation of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame we want the orientation. Specify -1 to retrieve the absolute orientation, 'sim.handle_parent' to retrieve the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame you want the orientation

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The (Qx,Qy,Qz,Qw) quaternion of the object

command.name: simxGetObjectPose
command.description: Retrieves the position and quaternion of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame we want the pose. Specify -1 to retrieve the absolute pose, 'sim.handle_parent' to retrieve the pose relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame you want the pose

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The (X,Y,Z,Qx,Qy,Qz,Qw) pose of the object

command.name: simxGetObjectMatrix
command.description: Retrieves the transformation matrix of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame we want the matrix. Specify -1 to retrieve the absolute matrix, 'sim.handle_parent' to retrieve the matrix relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame you want the matrix

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The (Xx,Yx,Zx,Px,Xy,Yy,Zy,Py,Xz,Yz,Zz,Pz) transformation matrix of the object

command.name: simxSetObjectPosition
command.description: Sets the position of an object. Dynamically simulated objects will implicitely be reset before the command is applied (i.e. similar to calling [L[regularApi/sim.resetDynamicObject.htm,sim.resetDynamicObject]] just before)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame the position is specified. Specify -1 to set the absolute position, 'sim.handle_parent' to set the position relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the position is specified

param.name: position
param.description: The desired (X,Y,Z) position

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetObjectOrientation
command.description: Sets the orientation (in Euler angles) of an object. Dynamically simulated objects will implicitely be reset before the command is applied (i.e. similar to calling [L[regularApi/sim.resetDynamicObject.htm,sim.resetDynamicObject]] just before)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame the orientation is specified. Specify -1 to set the absolute orientation, 'sim.handle_parent' to set the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the orientation is specified

param.name: euler
param.description: The desired (alpha,beta,gamma) Euler-angle orientation

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetObjectQuaternion
command.description: Sets the quaternion orientation of an object. Dynamically simulated objects will implicitely be reset before the command is applied (i.e. similar to calling [L[regularApi/sim.resetDynamicObject.htm,sim.resetDynamicObject]] just before)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame the orientation is specified. Specify -1 to set the absolute orientation, 'sim.handle_parent' to set the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the orientation is specified

param.name: quat
param.description: The desired (Qx,Qy,Qz,Qw) quaternion orientation

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetObjectPose
command.description: Sets the pose (position + quaternion) of an object. Dynamically simulated objects will implicitely be reset before the command is applied (i.e. similar to calling [L[regularApi/sim.resetDynamicObject.htm,sim.resetDynamicObject]] just before)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame the pose is specified. Specify -1 to set the absolute pose, 'sim.handle_parent' to set the pose relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the pose is specified

param.name: pose
param.description: The desired (X,Y,Z,Qx,Qy,Qz,Qw) pose

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetObjectMatrix
command.description: Sets the transformation matrix of an object. Dynamically simulated objects will implicitely be reset before the command is applied (i.e. similar to calling [L[regularApi/sim.resetDynamicObject.htm,sim.resetDynamicObject]] just before)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the object

param.name: relObjHandle
param.description: Indicates relative to which reference frame the matrix is specified. Specify -1 to set the absolute matrix, 'sim.handle_parent' to set the matrix relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the matrix is specified

param.name: matr
param.description: The desired (Xx,Yx,Zx,Px,Xy,Yy,Zy,Py,Xz,Yz,Zz,Pz) transformation matrix

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxClearFloatSignal
command.description: Clears a float [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]] (removes it)

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxClearIntegerSignal
command.description: Clears an int [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]] (removes it)

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxClearStringSignal
command.description: Clears a string [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]] (removes it)

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetFloatSignal
command.description: Sets a float [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]]

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: sigValue
param.description: The value of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetIntegerSignal
command.description: Sets an int [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]]

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: sigValue
param.description: The value of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetStringSignal
command.description: Sets a string [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]]. Such a signal represents a byte buffer

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: sigValue
param.description: The value of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetFloatSignal
command.description: Retrieves a float [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]]

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The value of the signal, or nil if the signal does not exist

command.name: simxGetIntegerSignal
command.description: Retrieves an int [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]]

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The value of the signal, or nil if the signal does not exist

command.name: simxGetStringSignal
command.description: Retrieves a string [L[meansOfCommunication.htm#signals,signal]]. Such a signal represents a byte buffer

param.name: sigName
param.description: The name of the signal

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The value of the signal, or nil if the signal does not exist

command.name: simxAuxiliaryConsoleClose
command.description: Closes an auxiliary console window

param.name: consoleHandle
param.description: The handle of the console window

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: 0 if the console doesn't exist (anymore), 1 if the console window was closed

command.name: simxAuxiliaryConsolePrint
command.description: Prints to an auxiliary console window

param.name: consoleHandle
param.description: The handle of the console window

param.name: text
param.description: The text to append, or the empty string to clear the console window

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: 0 if the console doesn't exist (anymore), 1 if the operation was successful

command.name: simxAuxiliaryConsoleShow
command.description: Shows or hides an auxiliary console window

param.name: consoleHandle
param.description: The handle of the console window

param.name: showState
param.description: The show state of the console window

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: 0 if the console doesn't exist (anymore), 1 if the console window's show state was changed

command.name: simxAuxiliaryConsoleOpen
command.description: Opens an auxiliary console window for text display

param.name: title
param.description: The title of the console window

param.name: maxLines
param.description: The number of text lines that can be displayed and buffered

param.name: mode
param.description: bit-coded value. Bit0 set indicates that the console window will automatically close at simulation end, bit1 set indicates that lines will be wrapped, bit2 set indicates that the user can close the console window, bit3 set indicates that the console will automatically be hidden during simulation pause, bit4 set indicates that the console will not automatically hide when the user switches to another scene

param.name: position
param.description: The initial position of the console window (x and y value)

param.name: size
param.description: The initial size of the console window (x and y value)

param.name: textColor
param.description: The color of the text (rgb values, 0-255)

param.name: backgroundColor
param.description: The background color of the window (rgb values, 0-255)

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the created console window

command.name: simxStartSimulation
command.description: Requests a start of a simulation (or a resume of a paused simulation)

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: 0 if the operation could not be performed. >0 in case of success

command.name: simxStopSimulation
command.description: Requests a stop of the running simulation

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: 0 if the operation could not be performed. >0 in case of success

command.name: simxGetVisionSensorImage
command.description: Retrieves the image of a vision sensor

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the vision sensor

param.name: greyScale
param.description: Whether the image should be grey scale or color

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The resolution of the image

param.name: item3
param.description: The image. In a grey scale image, each pixel is represented by one byte, with a color image, each pixel is represented by a RGB-byte-triplet

command.name: simxSetVisionSensorImage
command.description: Applies an image of a vision sensor

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the vision sensor

param.name: greyScale
param.description: Whether the provided image is grey scale or color

param.name: img
param.description: The image that must be provided in the same resolution as the vision sensor. In a grey scale image, each pixel is represented by one byte, with a color image, each pixel is represented by a RGB-byte-triplet

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetVisionSensorDepthBuffer
command.description: Retrieves the depth buffer of a vision sensor

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: The handle of the vision sensor

param.name: toMeters
param.description: Whether depth values are expressed in terms of relative distance to the sensor's clipping planes or whether depth values are expressed in terms of distance in meters

param.name: asByteArray
param.description: If true, then a byte array will be returned, instead of a float array, which is much faster (large float arrays might be very slow to handle with message pack, in several languages). In that case, the user is in charge of correctly decoding the byte array containing 4-byte floats, including little/big Endian conversions, etc.

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The resolution of the depth buffer

param.name: item3
param.description: The depth buffer. Values are in the range of 0-1 (0=on the near clipping plane, 1=on the far clipping plane). If [B[toMeters]] was specified, then values represent the distance from the sensor's origin, in meters

command.name: simxAddDrawingObject_points
command.description: Displays points in the scene

param.name: size
param.description: The pixel size of the points

param.name: color
param.description: The RGB color of the points (0-255)

param.name: coords
param.description: The coordinates for the points to display (3 per point)

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the created drawing object

command.name: simxAddDrawingObject_spheres
command.description: Displays spheres in the scene

param.name: size
param.description: The size of the spheres

param.name: color
param.description: The RGB color of the spheres (0-255)

param.name: coords
param.description: The coordinates for the spheres to display (3 per sphere)

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the created drawing object

command.name: simxAddDrawingObject_cubes
command.description: Displays cubes in the scene

param.name: size
param.description: The size of the cubes

param.name: color
param.description: The RGB color of the cubes (0-255)

param.name: coords
param.description: The coordinates for the cubes to display (3 per cube)

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the created drawing object

command.name: simxAddDrawingObject_segments
command.description: Displays line segments in the scene

param.name: lineSize
param.description: The size of the segments, in pixels

param.name: color
param.description: The RGB color of the cubes (0-255)

param.name: segments
param.description: The coordinates for the segments to display (6 per segment)

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the created drawing object

command.name: simxAddDrawingObject_triangles
command.description: Displays triangles in the scene

param.name: color
param.description: The RGB color of the triangles (0-255)

param.name: triangles
param.description: The coordinates for the triangles to display (9 per triangle)

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the created drawing object

command.name: simxRemoveDrawingObject
command.description: Removes a drawing object from the scene

param.name: handle
param.description: The drawing object handle to remove

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetCollisionHandle
command.description: Retrieves the handle of a [L[collisionDetection.htm,collision object]]

param.name: nameOfObject
param.description: The name of the collision object. If the name is appended by a "@silentError" suffix, then no error will be output if the collision object does not exist

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the collision object

command.name: simxGetDistanceHandle
command.description: Retrieves the handle of a [L[distanceCalculation.htm,distance calculation object]]

param.name: nameOfObject
param.description: The name of the distance calculation object. If the name is appended by a "@silentError" suffix, then no error will be output if the distance object does not exist

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the distance calculation object

command.name: simxReadCollision
command.description: Reads the collision state of a [L[collisionDetection.htm,collision object]]

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the collision object

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The collision state of the object

param.name: item3
param.description: handles of the colliding objects

command.name: simxReadDistance
command.description: Reads the distance state of a [L[distanceCalculation.htm,distance calculation object]]

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the distance calculation object

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: 0 if distance was not yet computed, 1 otherwise

param.name: item3
param.description: The smallest distance

command.name: simxCheckCollision
command.description: Checks whether two [L[collidableObjects.htm,collidable]] [L[entities.htm,entities]] are colliding

param.name: entity1
param.description: The handle of the first entity

param.name: entity2
param.description: The handle of the second entity. Can also be the 'sim.handle_all' string, to check entity1 against all other collidable objects

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The collision state of the object

command.name: simxCheckDistance
command.description: Computes the minimum distance between two [L[measurableObjects.htm,measurable]] [L[entities.htm,entities]]

param.name: entity1
param.description: The handle of the first entity

param.name: entity2
param.description: The handle of the second entity. Can also be the 'sim.handle_all' string, to check entity1 against all other measurable objects

param.name: threshold
param.description: If distance is bigger than the threshold, the distance is not calculated. If threshold is 0 or negative, then no threshold is used

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: 0 is distance is larger than the threshold, 1 otherwise

param.name: item3
param.description: The minimum distance

param.name: item4
param.description: The first point of the minimum distance segment

param.name: item5
param.description: The second point of the minimum distance segment

command.name: simxReadProximitySensor
command.description: Reads the calculation result of a proximity sensor

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the proximity sensor

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: detection state (0 or 1)

param.name: item3
param.description: The distance to the detected point

param.name: item4
param.description: The detected point relative to the sensor frame

param.name: item5
param.description: The detected object handle

param.name: item6
param.description: The normal vector of the detected surface, relative to the sensor frame

command.name: simxCheckProximitySensor
command.description: Computes the detection state of a proximity sensor, for a specific [L[detectableObjects.htm,detectable]] [L[entities.htm,entity]]

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the proximity sensor

param.name: entity
param.description: The handle of the entity to detect. Can also be the 'sim.handle_all' string, to check all detectable entities

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: detection state (0 or 1)

param.name: item3
param.description: The distance to the detected point

param.name: item4
param.description: The detected point relative to the sensor frame

command.name: simxReadForceSensor
command.description: Reads the force and torque applied to a force sensor (filtered values are read), and its current state ('unbroken' or 'broken')

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the force sensor

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The sensor state (bit coded: bit0 set=force/torque data is valid, bit1 set=force sensor is broken)

param.name: item3
param.description: The applied force

param.name: item4
param.description: The applied torque

command.name: simxBreakForceSensor
command.description: Allows breaking a force sensor during simulation. A broken force sensor will lose its positional and orientational constraints

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the force sensor

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxReadVisionSensor
command.description: Reads the state of a vision sensor

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the vision sensor

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: detection state (0 or 1)

param.name: item3
param.description: The default auxiliary value packet. See [L[regularApi/simReadVisionSensor.htm,here] for details

param.name: item4
param.description: Additional auxiliary value packet (e.g. from a filter component)

param.name: item5
param.description: Etc.

command.name: simxCheckVisionSensor
command.description: Computes the detection state of a vision sensor, for a specific [L[renderableObjects.htm,renderable]] [L[entities.htm,entity]]

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the vision sensor

param.name: entity
param.description: The handle of the entity to detect. Can also be the 'sim.handle_all' string, to check all renderable entities

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: detection state (0 or 1)

param.name: item3
param.description: The distance to the detected point

param.name: item4
param.description: The detected point relative to the sensor frame

command.name: simxCopyPasteObjects
command.description: Duplicates objects

param.name: objectHandles
param.description: The handles of the objects to copy and paste

param.name: options
param.description: Bit-coded. If bit0 is set (i.e. 1), then whole models will be copied

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: handles of the duplicates

command.name: simxRemoveObjects
command.description: Removes objects or models

param.name: objectHandles
param.description: The handles of the objects/models to remove

param.name: options
param.description: Bit-coded. If bit0 is set (i.e. 1), then whole models will be removed. If bit1 is set (i.e. 2), then all objects and models will be removed

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The number of removed objects

command.name: simxCloseScene
command.description: Closes current scene, and switches to another open scene

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetStringParameter
command.description: Sets a [L[apiConstants.htm#stringParameters,string parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.stringparam_scene_name'

param.name: paramVal
param.description: The value of the parameter

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetFloatParameter
command.description: Sets a [L[apiConstants.htm#floatingParameters,float parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.floatparam_simulation_time_step'

param.name: paramVal
param.description: The value of the parameter

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetIntParameter
command.description: Sets an [L[apiConstants.htm#integerParameters,integer parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.intparam_program_version'

param.name: paramVal
param.description: The value of the parameter

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxSetBoolParameter
command.description: Sets a [L[apiConstants.htm#booleanParameters,boolean parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.boolparam_proximity_sensor_handling_enabled'

param.name: paramVal
param.description: The value of the parameter

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetStringParameter
command.description: Retrieves a [L[apiConstants.htm#stringParameters,string parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.stringparam_scene_name'

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The value of the parameter

command.name: simxGetFloatParameter
command.description: Retrieves a [L[apiConstants.htm#floatingParameters,float parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.floatparam_simulation_time_step'

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The value of the parameter

command.name: simxGetIntParameter
command.description: Retrieves an [L[apiConstants.htm#integerParameters,integer parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.intparam_program_version'

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The value of the parameter

command.name: simxGetBoolParameter
command.description: Retrieves a [L[apiConstants.htm#booleanParameters,boolean parameter]]

param.name: paramId
param.description: The parameter identifier. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.boolparam_proximity_sensor_handling_enabled'

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The value of the parameter

command.name: simxDisplayDialog
command.description: Displays a generic dialog box

param.name: titleText
param.description: The title bar text

param.name: mainText
param.description: The information text

param.name: dialogType
param.description: The [L[apiConstants.htm#genericDialogStyles,generic dialog style]]. Can also be a string value, e.g. 'sim.dlgstyle_message'

param.name: inputText
param.description: The initial text in the edit box if the dialog is an input dialog

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the dialog

command.name: simxGetDialogResult
command.description: Queries the result of a generic dialog box

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the generic dialog

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The [L[result of the dialog,apiConstants.htm#genericDialogReturnValues]], as a string

command.name: simxGetDialogInput
command.description: Queries the input of a generic dialog box

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the generic dialog

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The input text

command.name: simxEndDialog
command.description: Closes and releases resource from a previous call to [L[#simxDisplayDialog]]. Even if the dialog is not visible anymore, you should release resources by using this function

param.name: handle
param.description: The handle of the generic dialog

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxExecuteScriptString
command.description: Executes a Lua string (i.e. runs the code)

param.name: code
param.description: The string to execute

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The first return value of the executed string

param.name: item3
param.description: The second return value of the executed string

param.name: item4
param.description: etc.

command.name: simxGetCollectionHandle
command.description: Retrieves the handle of a collection

param.name: collectionName
param.description: Name of the collection. If the name is appended by a "@silentError" suffix, then no error will be output if the collection does not exist

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The handle of the collection

command.name: simxGetJointForce
command.description: Retrieves the force or torque applied to a joint along/about its active axis

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The force or the torque applied to the joint along/about its z-axis, or nil if no value is available yet

command.name: simxSetJointForce
command.description: Sets the maximum force or torque that a joint can exert

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: forceOrTorque
param.description: The maximum force or torque that the joint can exert

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetJointPosition
command.description: Retrieves the intrinsic position of a joint

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The position of the joint, in radians or meters

command.name: simxSetJointPosition
command.description: Sets the intrinsic position of a joint

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: position
param.description: The position of the joint, in radians or meters

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetJointTargetPosition
command.description: Retrieves the target position of a joint

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The target position of the joint, in radians or meters

command.name: simxSetJointTargetPosition
command.description: Sets the target position of a joint

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: targetPos
param.description: The target position of the joint, in radians or meters

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

command.name: simxGetJointTargetVelocity
command.description: Retrieves the target velocity of a joint

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side

param.name: item2
param.description: The target velocity of the joint, in radians/s or meters/s

command.name: simxSetJointTargetVelocity
command.description: Sets the target velocity of a joint

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: The handle of the joint

param.name: targetPos
param.description: The target velocity of the joint, in radians/s or meters/s

param.name: topic
param.description: The [L[#topics,topic or communication channel]] to use for executing the function call

param.name: item1
param.description: Whether the function was successfully called on the server side
